text: Very beautiful and well maintained seaman church in Mt Faber. The place is clean and neat. Was closed when I was there on Saturday evening. But the building itself is so stunning to see.

üè´Danish Seamen's Church was originally Golden Bell Mansion owned by prominent philanthropist Tan Boon Liat.
‚õ™It is now a Danish Seamen's Church that function as a venue for recreational activities and church services for Danish community in Singapore.
üè´This Edwardian-style Historic building was gazetted as part of the Southern Ridges conservation area on June 2005.
Amazingly peaceful place with a small worship hall.

If you are Danish and in the area this church is worth a visit
You can buy different things and food from Denmark

Hi! Was in a terrible mood yesterday and for some reason today just got up and took a stroll, told God I wouldn‚Äôt stop walking until I found Him. I somehow strolled to mount faber park and He met me at this church, with a piano I found inside I worshipped Him, as well as uh a prayer book that really spoke to me when I flipped it open, so thanks! But uh I think you left the fan on upstairs, I can‚Äôt switch it off because the door is locked. Hope it doesn‚Äôt waste too much energy. Once again, thank you for this wonderful building God used to speak to me!
